title: Cover Picture and Issue Information
content:
Cover image: An abandoned and crumbling Tanya in Hungary. A Tanya usually consists of only one house, or very few houses with small farm buildings, and are typically built out of mud-brick. Today, around 250,000 people live in Tanyas, frequently without running water or electricity. (pp. 1982–1988).

Photo: © Péter Batáry.
